revised_title: Auroral Results from Halley Bay during the International Geophysical Year
tldr: The article discusses the auroral observations and results from the Royal Society's expedition to Halley Bay, Antarctica, during the International Geophysical Year. The authors analyze the data collected, including the position and behavior of quiet arcs, the direction of flaming aurorae, and the coloration of the auroras. They also explore the possible connections between these observations and solar activity, the outer Van Allen radiation belt, and geomagnetic disturbances.
